abstract: Trial challenging North Carolina's voting laws begins, with plaintiffs arguing that legislation was deliberately drafted to reduce voting by African-Americans and state saying revisions applied equally to all, and are law in other states.
lead_paragraph: In opening statements of a federal trial, civil rights groups and the Justice Department argued the state had turned back the clock with changes to election laws, while the state said the revisions applied equally to all.

headline.main: Sides Dispute Basis of North Carolina Voting Laws as Trial Contesting Them Opens
